qas.question: Zones in which mountains are built along convergent tectonic plate boundaries are called what?
What are among the most well known experiments in structural geology?
Horizontal layers of what are pulled along a surface into a back stop in analog versions of orogenic wedge experiments?
Which is more sophisticated, numericals model or an analog models of orogenic wedges?
What do orogenic wedges work in the same way as?
What are analog models often considered as compared to orogenic wedges?
What do analog models include in the pathway for metamorphism?

plausible_answers.text: through pressure, temperature, space, and time

qas.question: How do studies give information about tectonic plate boundaries?
What are some of the most well known experiments in patterns of faulting?
What are layers of sand pulled out of?
How are analog models different than numerical models?
What are horizontal layers of sand called?

plausible_answers.text: the relationship between erosion and the shape of the mountain range.

qas.question: What do studies on metamorphism through pressure help clarify?

plausible_answers.text: patterns of erosion and uplift in the mountain belt.

qas.question: What does an analog model have that a numerical model doesn not?
